title: Fire at Swindon waste recycling centre extinguished
article: A fire at a waste recycling centre in Swindon which prompted an evacuation of the site has been put out. Emergency services were called to the recycling centre on Cheney Manor Industrial Estate just before 11:00 GMT on Friday. The site was evacuated, with residents and local businesses asked to close their windows due to the fire. Dorset and Wiltshire Fire and Rescue Service said the accidental fire started in a domestic waste baler. At the height of the fire there were 10 crews at the site, with the blaze extinguished by about 15:15 GMT. Follow BBC West on Facebook , Twitter and Instagram .
